notes.text:
An update for jenkins-2-plugins is now available for Red Hat OpenShift
Container Platform 4.1.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact
of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which
gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from
the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
This advisory contains the jenkins-2-plugins RPM packages for Red Hat
OpenShift Container Platform 4.1.4. See the following advisory for the
container images for this release:

https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2019:1635

Security Fix(es):

* jenkins-plugin-workflow-remote-loader: Unsafe Script Security whitelist 
entry in Pipeline Remote Loader Plugin (CVE-2019-10328)

* jenkins-credentials-plugin: Certificate file read vulnerability in
Credentials Plugin (CVE-2019-10320)

* jenkins-plugin-token-macro: XML External Entity processing the ${XML}
macro (CVE-2019-10337)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS
score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE
page(s) listed in the References section.

You may download the oc tool and use it to inspect release image metadata
as follows:

  $ oc adm release info quay.io/openshift-release-dev/ocp-release:4.1.4

The image digest is sha256:a6c177eb007d20bb00bfd8f829e99bd40137167480112bd5ae1c25e40a4a163a

All OpenShift Container Platform 4.1 users are advised to upgrade to these
updated packages and images.
notes.title: Details

full_product_name.name: jenkins-2-plugins-0:4.1.1561471763-1.el7.noarch as a component of Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform 4.1

notes.text: Jenkins Credentials Plugin 2.1.18 and earlier allowed users with permission to create or update credentials to confirm the existence of files on the Jenkins master with an attacker-specified path, and obtain the certificate content of files containing a PKCS#12 certificate.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jenkins-credentials-plugin: Certificate file read vulnerability in Credentials Plugin (SECURITY-1322)
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For OpenShift Container Platform 4.1 see the following documentation, which
will be updated shortly for release 4.1.4, for important instructions on
how to upgrade your cluster and fully apply this asynchronous errata
update:

https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.1/release_notes/ocp-4-1-release-notes.html

vulnerabilities.title: jenkins-credentials-plugin: Certificate file read vulnerability in Credentials Plugin (SECURITY-1322)

notes.text: A flaw was found in the Jenkins Workflow Remote Loader plugin. An unsafe whitelist entry was made that allowed invoking arbitrary methods and bypassing sandbox protection. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jenkins-plugin-workflow-remote-loader: Unsafe Script Security whitelist entry in Pipeline Remote Loader Plugin (SECURITY-921)
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

vulnerabilities.title: jenkins-plugin-workflow-remote-loader: Unsafe Script Security whitelist entry in Pipeline Remote Loader Plugin (SECURITY-921)

cwe.name: Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference

notes.text: An XML external entities (XXE) vulnerability in Jenkins Token Macro Plugin 2.7 and earlier allowed attackers able to control a the content of the input file for the "XML" macro to have Jenkins resolve external entities, resulting in the extraction of secrets from the Jenkins agent, server-side request forgery, or denial-of-service attacks.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jenkins-plugin-token-macro: XML External Entity processing the ${XML} macro
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability
